numlitem.para: Associated pack is selected OFF,
Lower lobe cargo A/C FLOW RATE (if installed) remains OFF, and
Associated Pack Flow Control & Shutoff Valve is secured closed.

note.para: Lower Lobe cargo A/C Flow Rate is installed on UPS aircraft.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Carriage of animals and perishables in associated cargo compartment is prohibited.
Increase flight plan fuel by 0.6% due to 2 packs operating in HI FLOW Mode.

placard.para: Placard as instructed in DMP Procedure 21-51-1. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Position the associated Bleed Air Control panel (P5) PACK selector OFF.
Secure the affected Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve closed:
Access valve through the air conditioning equipment bay access doors.
Manually rotate crank arm on end of butterfly shaft until valve is closed.
Run screw on end of crank into hole in the casting.

Manually select HI FLOW on remaining packs and advise flight crew that HI FLOW must remain selected to ensure that these packs will operate in High Flow Mode. The associated PACK_ advisory message may be displayed.
If the affected Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve has an external maintenance canister installed containing a lockout device (a cap, a spring and a plug):

Remove the existing pack flow control and shutoff valve plug, packing, spring and filter from the inoperative Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve per AMM 21-51-13. Retain all removed parts for later storage in the canister.
Remove the perforated plug from the canister containing the lockout device (the canister is located near the end of the crank screw noted in step E. (1)).
Remove the cap and spring from inside the canister.
Install the cap and spring into the filter cavity: The small end of cap fits into the inside diameter of the spring. Ensure the cap is seated at the bottom of the filter cavity.
Apply anti-seize compound to the threads on the perforated plug obtained from the canister.
Install and tighten the perforated plug that was obtained from the canister: Tighten the plug to 60-70 pound-inches (6.78-7.90 newton-meters).
Install a lockwire on the perforated plug with the hole.
Place the removed plug, packing, spring and filter (from step E. (1)) into the canister for storage and future restoration of the Pack Flow Control and Shutoff Valve function.
Position the Overhead Maintenance Panel (P461) LOWER CARGO COND FLOW RATE selector to "OFF".

Placard adjacent to associated Pack selector "INOP - OFF" and PACK ___ FLOW CONTROL AND SHUTOFF VALVE INOP CLOSED". Install Placard adjacent to Lower Lobe CARGO COND AIR FLOW RATE selector on Overhead Maintenance panel (P461) INOP OFF. Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
